muxdanger.Amount of data preloaded in memory befor:
Amount of data preloaded in memory before it's requested

Larger values improve sequential read performance
muxdanger.Automatically adjusts scheduler behaviou:
Automatically adjusts scheduler behaviour based on CPU count

Disable for consistent tuning on devices
muxdanger.Background write back starts when dirty:
Background write back starts when dirty data exceeds this percentage of RAM

Lower values help reduce latency
muxdanger.Controls how aggressively the system swa:
Controls how aggressively the system swaps memory to disk

Lower values keep processes in RAM longer
muxdanger.Controls how kernel merges I/O requests\:
Controls how kernel merges I/O requests

Disabling merges may benefit specific flash storage performance
muxdanger.Enables or disables tracking of per-devi:
Enables or disables tracking of per-device I/O statistics

Disabling may improve performance slightly
muxdanger.Flushes dirty data on idle instead of us:
Flushes dirty data on idle instead of using write back thresholds

Useful for flash storage or reducing idle power
muxdanger.Higher values reclaim cached file data m:
Higher values reclaim cached file data more aggressively

Lower values improve performance for repeated file access
muxdanger.How long real-time tasks run before swit:
How long real-time tasks run before switching

Lower values favour responsiveness, higher values favour throughput
muxdanger.Number of pages read ahead when swapping:
Number of pages read ahead when swapping

Lower values = less latency, higher = more efficient bulk reads
muxdanger.Percentage of RAM allowed to hold unwrit: Percentage of RAM allowed to hold unwritten (dirty) data before forcing a write to disk
muxdanger.Sets the maximum number of queued I/O re:
Sets the maximum number of queued I/O requests per device

Higher values increase throughput but use more RAM
muxdanger.Switch between different storage tuning:
Switch between different storage tuning options

May improve performance on certain mSD cards
muxdanger.Switch between system sleep suspend stat:
Switch between system sleep suspend states

Changes how the device reacts to sleep mode and wake locks
muxdanger.When enabled, a newly forked child proce:
When enabled, a newly forked child process runs before the parent

May improve load times for some apps

muxdevice.Toggles internal Portmaster support on d: Toggles internal Portmaster support on device
muxdevice.Toggles kernel level DebugFS mount on st:
Toggles kernel level DebugFS mount on startup

Best to leave this enabled unless otherwise advised!

muxnetadv.Adjusts how many retries the network con: Adjusts how many retries the network connection script goes through before giving up
muxnetadv.Adjusts the maximum amount of attempts a:
Adjusts the maximum amount of attempts at loading the network module with Module Compatibility enabled. Increase this setting if you are still unable to connect to wifi.

Increasing this setting may increase boot times importantly.
muxnetadv.Adjusts the maximum amount of time waiti:
Adjusts the maximum amount of time waiting for the network interface to appear.

WARNING:
If you enable Module Compatibility, it is not advisable to increase this setting as it will increase boot times!
muxnetadv.Enable device compatibility with network:
Enable device compatibility with network module loading via the Linux kernel

Increases boot times moderately
muxnetadv.Enable the background handling of compat:
Enable the background handling of compatibility handling

Provides faster boot times with compatibility enabled, disable this only if all else has failed
muxnetadv.Enables network connection to be establi: Enables network connection to be established automatically at boot
muxnetadv.Enables network connection to be re-esta: Enables network connection to be re-established automatically upon suspend wake
muxnetadv.Enables periodic connectivity checks and: Enables periodic connectivity checks and triggers reconnection if network loss is detected

muxthemefilter.Filter to theme with a name containing l: 検索文字列を含むテーマ名に絞り込みます

muxthemefilter.Filter to themes that support HDMI resol: Filter to themes that support HDMI resolution 1280x720. Themes will still work on HDMI without support for 1280x720 but content will be letterboxed.

システムの起動・終了時に詳細を表示します

muxtweakadv.Toggle the forced settings MustardOS pla: Toggle the forced settings MustardOS places on RetroArch configurations

例えば「Batman and Robin, The」は「The Batman and Robin」となります

muxwebserv.SFTP + Filebrowser: SFTP + ファイルブラウザ
muxwebserv.Toggle SFTP support - WebUI can be found: SFTP を起動します - 9090番ポートからWebUIに接続してください
muxwebserv.Toggle SSH support - Access via port 22: SSH を起動します - 22番ポートで接続してください
